Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

= causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
= state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice
= action by which someone speaks in order to defend oneself or to accuse someone else; sometimes accompanied by actions
= state in which someone lacks intelligence, refinement and culture
= state in which humans and deities have character, integrity, and good fortune
= to attain a particular state or position
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= plan or strategy thought out by humans or deities to accomplish a certain goal; ≈ when used for humans, only used in a negative sense

Node.gloss: to declare guilty|to condemn as guilty
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities declare (other) humans guilty before God or humanity, ◄ as a result of (allegedly) having acted in a way that is contrary to the law
literally: to be established; hence: = process by which humans find security and stability
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= a part of a plant normally below ground, which acts as a support and collects water and nourishment, ≈ associated with well being, offspring, and the inclination of the mind
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= state in which an object is not firmly fixed to the surface on which it stands so that it can move or slip; to waver
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

= state in which a human being, animal, or deity is deemed worthy of respect because of characteristics such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

= circular or semi circular ornamental headdress, ◄ usually made out of precious metals and decorated with jewels, ► worn by kings, priests, and officials as a symbol of authority and status; also given to women by their suitors to win their affection
= person exercising authority over people, animals, or inanimate objects in the role of owner, ruler, or husband
literally: bones; hence: = the physical body of a human being

Node.gloss: to put to shame|to bring shame
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone causes someone else to forfeit the respect of the community, by provoking a situation that is not in accordance to that person's status
= procedure for achieving a certain purpose, originating from someone's לֵב mind
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= practices that conform to the laws of God

Node.gloss: to lie in wait|to lay an ambush|to lurk
Node.definition: = to go to a location where one will not be readily seen by others; ► and wait there for an opportunity to seize or attack someone or do something else that is supposed to be done when nobody else can witness it
= causative action by which humans kill other humans in a violent way, usually involving the shedding of blood, which brings guilt upon the people committing these acts
= an action by which humans and deities utter words, ◄ as coming from their mouths
= person whose behavior is morally and ethically right
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation
= causative action by which humans or deities destroy an object completely ◄ as if by turning it completely upside down

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= a linker indicating that two propositions are proportional to one another in quantity, frequency, intensity, or content
= action by which humans or divine beings express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to (other) humans or deities about who they are and what they do
= state in which the human mind is flawed
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others

Node.gloss: to be of low esteem|to be held in contempt|to be degraded|to be humiliated
Node.definition: = state/process in wich humans provoke disdain from the general public ◄ due to their lower social standing, poverty, or condition; ≈ people in this situation are generally expected to pay respect to those of a higher standing

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

Node.gloss: to put on airs|to play the important man
Node.definition: = pattern of actions in which humans behave as people worthy of honor
= state in which humans lack something that they are supposed to have
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
literally: to know; hence: = state in which humans or deities are actively involved in circumstances relating to the life of humans and animals and care for their well being
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= general term for any animal that has been domesticated; ≈ considered part of someone's wealth
= state in which humans feel compassion for others, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action
= pertaining to being without mercy towards humans and animals

Node.gloss: to work|to till|to plow (soil, flax)|to dress (a vineyard)
Node.definition: literally, to serve; therefore = action by which workers prepare land of planting and harvesting; also refers to caring for a vineyard, processing linen, or using cattle for working the land

= the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again
= process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= state in which humans lack a particular quality that they are supposed to have
literally: heart; hence: = the ability to think for oneself as opposed to being easily swayed by what others say or do
= process by which humans or deities experience an eager desire for a person or object

= area shaped and located in such a way that it is hard to access and can be easily defended against enemies; ◄ this can be a natural stronghold in the mountains (e.g. caves) or a construction erected by humans in populated areas; ≈ often associated with security and sometimes used as an epithet for leaders or deities that are considered providers of security
= condition of a human or a spirit that is not considered morally good or pure or right; can refer to an individual, a group, or a nation
= a part of a plant normally below ground, which acts as a support and collects water and nourishment, ≈ associated with well being, offspring, and the inclination of the mind
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression
= contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control
= condition of a human or a spirit that is not considered morally good or pure or right; can refer to an individual, a group, or a nation
literally: to go out (from a circumstance); hence: = process by which humans are no longer affected by a certain circumstance
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= the resulting effect of one's act or speech or decision
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted

Node.gloss: to be satisfied (with something)|to have one's fill (of something)
Node.definition: literally: to be satiated (with an event); hence: = process by which humans become more than fully engaged in a certain process or activity, which can be either good or bad
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= action by which humans act towards other humans or deities in a way that has consequences and can result either in retribution or a reward
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

Node.gloss: to be repaid|to be paid back|to be punished
Node.definition: literally: to come back on (someone's) head; hence: = process by which humans receive the appropriate return for their actions, which are mostly evil
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= pertaining to being foolish, which manifests itself in a lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, much talking, and being unable to conceal one's emotions
= state in which an event is morally and ethically right

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= pertaining to being foolish, which manifests itself in a lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, much talking, and being unable to conceal one's emotions
literally: as (on) this day; hence: = at this moment or as soon as possible
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= state in which human experience displeasure, which is said to reside in their heart (לֵב) ◄ and is caused by their own condition or by someone else
literally: to cover (information); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities keep certain information hidden from others
= state which provokes disdain from the general public or from a specific category of people ◄ due to one's behavior or condition

= state in which someone is be able to manipulate difficult circumstances in such a way that the outcome is favorable to the planner; ≈ sometimes used in a positive sense, but also used in a negative sense
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their actions

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= a person or deity who has evidence that something has taken place or that some decision has been made
literally: falsehood; hence: = state in which things that are being communicated are factually untrue
= action by which humans speak without due consideration as to attitude or content
= causative action by which humans thrust violently against other humans with a sharp weapon, ► with the aim of wounding them or ending their lives
= offensive weapon consisting of long blade for cutting or thrusting or both, and hilt with hand guard; ◄ made out of iron; ► used in warfare; ≈ symbol of aggression and punishment
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions

Node.gloss: to be established|to endure|to be secure
Node.definition: literally: to be established; hence: = process by which a condition becomes stable and can be expected to last for a long time
= an adverb that specifies unending time
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
literally: until I will wink; hence: = state in which an event lasts for a very short length of time
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
literally: falsehood; hence: = state in which things that are being communicated are factually untrue
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= action by which someone exercises his mind (לֵב) in order to determine a course of action that will achieve a certain purpose; ≈ mostly associated with evil purposes
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong
= action by which humans or deities exercise their minds to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose
= state in which humans feel and show great joy
= process by which something happens to humans
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= state in which humans are suffering caused by difficult circumstances; ≈ often seen as the consequences of their own wickedness

Node.gloss: to be filled > to be engaged
Node.definition: literally: to be filled (with an activity); hence: = state in which humans are fully engaged in a certain activity, either as victim or as active participant
= state of an event or an object that is very difficult or painful or harmful; also used to describe the attitude or emotion in reaction to such an event
= people, animals, and inanimate objects that are considered utterly wrong and detestable, because of their condition, their behavior, or because of certain customs
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: falsehood; hence: = state in which things that are being communicated are factually untrue

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their actions
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

= state in which someone is be able to manipulate difficult circumstances in such a way that the outcome is favorable to the planner; ≈ sometimes used in a positive sense, but also used in a negative sense
literally: to cover (information); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities keep certain information hidden from others
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities make a public announcement
= state of being regarded as foolish, ◄ because of lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, talking too much, and being unable to conceal one's temper
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
= state in which humans are ready and prepared to act when needed
= state or condition of a person unequipped or unwilling to work or be attentive to responsibilities
= a class of people who are enlisted compulsorily to do work for others

= state in which humans experience fear, anxiety, or distress ◄ out of uncertainty of what might happen to themselves or their beloved ones; ► which may express itself in trembling and shaking of the body
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= to cause someone to walk with his head down ◄ caused by grief and anxiety
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= causative action where human or deities cause (other) humans to feel and show great joy
literally: to cause to roam; hence: = causative action by which humans show other humans the course in life that they need to take
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

Node.gloss: to roast (meat, after a hunting party)
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans cook the meat of an animal by exposure to open fire
= state or condition of a person unequipped or unwilling to work or be attentive to responsibilities
= wild animal that has been tracked and caught for food
= a large quantity of valuable resources, ownership of which affects the way people think and live
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= state in which humans or objects are considered valuable and desirable
= state in which humans are ready and prepared to act when needed
= a pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= process by which humans or animals stop living
